silva's lining Monaco star Bernardo Silva admits he is flattered to be linked with Manchester United and Chelsea 
Young midfielder is the talisman in exciting French side and has attracted interest across Europe with some stunning displays By Fred Nathan Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments MONACO star Bernardo Silva has admitted he is flattered to be linked with Premier League giants Manchester United and Chelsea. 
The young midfielder is the talisman in exciting Ligue 1 side and has attracted interest across Europe with some stunning displays . Getty Images 4 Bernardo Silva is another of Monaco’s hot young talents destined for the Premier League one day 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester City news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Tonight, the 22-year-old comes up against Premier League Manchester City at the Stade Louis II in the second leg of their last-16 Champions League tie – trailing 5-3 from the first leg. 
And how he plays will be looked at closely by Manchester United and Chelsea as both clubs are linked with a summer move for the Portugal international. Getty Images 4 Manchester United are reported to have secret first option for Bernardo Silva with Chelsea also keen 
And speaking to the Times , he did not immediately quell interest from England. He said: “Yes I heard the reports. 
“I have no idea if it’s true or not. Of course it’s nice to be associated with that kind of club but I haven’t thought a lot about it. One day I would like to play in England or Spain, in one of the best leagues in the world, but for now I’m very happy here.” 
Antonio Conte's Blues have been linked with a £70million move for the playmaker, while Jose Mourinho is said to want him on his wishlist this summer. Getty Images 4 Bernardo Silva is on the radar of a host of European giants and said is flattered by it 
Silva was signed in the summer of 2014 initially on loan from Benfica, where he had made only one first-team appearance. 
And while eyebrows were initially raised, Monaco went on to sign him permanently for around £12 million - and he is now valued FIVE TIMES more than that. Getty Images 4 But he faces an uphill task tonight after Manchester City romped to a 5-3 win in the first leg 
Monaco are top of Ligue 1 having already scored 123 goals in all competitions this season - more than any other team in the top French, English, German, Italian or Spanish leagues. 
But they go into tonight's game with a small mountain to climb after Pep Guardiola's City scored five at the Etihad thanks to two from Sergio Aguero, and goals from John Stones, Leroy Sane and Raheem Sterling.
